discussion.content: I agree with C and D.

choices.D: virtual machine hardware version 15 or higher
choices.C: set the disk.EnableUUID advanced setting to TRUE
choices.B: Set the Disk Mode to Independent

questions.question_text: Which two are requirements for Kubernetes cluster virtual machines when leveraging vSphere Cloud Native Storage (CNS)? (Choose two.)

choices.D: All hosts are in maintenance mode.

questions.question_text: Which should be verified before enabling deduplication and compression?

discussion.content: A is correct as extra space is need for the formatting operation

I agree with A.
Additional space will be used to rebuild components as the disk groups are reformatted.

choices.A: Encrypted VM disks are not supported with VMware vSAN, only encrypted vSAN datastore.
choices.C: If source VMs have encrypted disks, the target storage policy cannot include a VM encryption rule.
choices.B: If a source VM has encrypted disks, the VM storage policy must be encrypted.
choices.D: If VMs have encrypted disks, the VM storage policy has a choice of encrypted or not encrypted.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I believe is correct

I agree with Alefin, I think B is correct.
When using VM Replication if the source VM is encrypted then you must select a storage policy at the target which has encryption enabled.
See link provided by Alefin.

questions.question_text:
A storage administrator is consolidating 2 data centers running on an HCI platform. There is a single site deployment of VMs running on the HCI platform with vSAN encryption. The administrator would like to protect data using replication and has these tools available:
✑ vSphere replication
✑ VM encryption
✑ VMware vSAN
Considering the scenario, which statement is correct?

discussion.content:
Answer is D. 
Set the number of days that vRealize Operations keeps the data, after which it is purged from the system. The default value is 90 days.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Operations/8.10/com.vmware.vcom.user.doc/GUID-123DDD0F-DB86-4D4B-8AC1-A55C7D54276F.html
C es correct answer. "3 months ago" (90 day trial period has expired)

choices.C: Apply the correct license to the vSAN cluster.

questions.question_text:
Three months ago, an administrator deployed vRealize Operations Manager from vCenter to manage his newly deployed four-node vSAN 6.7 All-Flash cluster.
What must the administrator do to continue using vRealize Operations Dashboards for vSAN?

choices.A: Use LACP on the distributed switch with a route based on IP hash algorithm.
choices.D: Create an additional TCP/IP stack within the cluster and specify vSAN type.
choices.B: Create multiple VMkernel adapters on the same subnet for vSAN.
choices.C: Configure multicast to use two separate network interfaces for vSAN traffic.

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing network high availability for a new vSAN Cluster.
Which is a supported configuration for this design?
